channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Are ICE agents in Minneapolis breaking the law?
item.description: As protestors clash with some 3,000 federal immigration agents in the Twin Cities, we look at the legal issues with law professor Emmanuel Mauleón and...

item.title: Lindsey Halligan, Trump's former personal attorney, exits Virginia prosecutor's office
item.description: The move comes after a federal judge wrote in court document that the "charade of Ms. Halligan masquerading as the United States Attorney … must come ...

item.title: Supreme Court appears wary of allowing Trump to fire Federal Reserve's Cook
item.description: The Trump administration wants the authority to fire Lisa Cook, a Federal Reserve governor. Experts say that would undermine the independence of the c...

item.title: House Oversight panel votes to hold Bill and Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress
item.description: Republicans on the committee have been seeking to question the Clintons as part of a probe into the government's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein case....

item.title: Global buzzwords that will be buzzing in your ear in 2026
item.description: Will it be a year of "fractured resilience"? Or "pragmatic empathy"? Will "MOUs" be the next global health strategy? Are we in a new age of "decoloniz...

item.title: Wealth inequality in America just hit its widest gap in three decades.
item.description: Nearly one-third of U.S. household wealth was held by the top 1% in the third quarter of 2025.

item.title: Seven more countries agree to join Trump's Board of Peace
item.description: Seven Muslim-majority countries publicly accept an invitation to Trump's new organisation, joining Albania, Bahran, Hungary, Morocco and Israel.

item.title: Minneapolis businesses struggle during Trump’s immigration enforcement surge
Supreme Court sceptical of Trump firing of central bank governor Lisa Cook
item.description: One conservative justice warned that the White House interpretation of the law could "shatter" Federal Reserve independence.

item.title: Immigration officers assert sweeping power to enter homes without a judge’s warrant, memo says
Wacky jobs: Doggy treat tasters
item.description: "Sunday Morning" takes a look at a few occupations where employees' jobs are far from ordinary. Susan Spencer gets a peak inside the taste test crew a...

item.title: Trump touts policies aimed at promoting homeownership in Davos speech
item.description: President Trump said his plans for boosting home affordability are already helping, but stopped short of providing details.

item.title: Concerns mount over Reza Valizadeh, Iranian-American journalist wrongfully detained in Iran
item.description: Reza Valizadeh, a 49-year-old dual U.S.-Iranian citizen and longtime critic of Iran, was arrested in September 2024 by the Islamic Revolutionary Guard...

item.title: EU suspends approval of US trade deal
item.description: The move follows renewed tensions between the US and EU, as Donald Trump pushes to acquire Greenland.

item.title: Justice Dept. kills cases cracking down on auto emissions cheating
item.description: The Justice Department ordered prosecutors to drop all pending cases targeting the sale of illicit "defeat devices" in diesel-powered vehicles.

item.title: Court lifts restrictions on immigration officers’ tactics in Minnesota
item.description: An appeals court has suspended a decision that restricts the aggressive tactics of immigration officers in Minnesota.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell to testify before US Congress in Epstein probe
item.description: The convicted sex trafficker has previously said she would decline to answer questions unless she is granted immunity.

item.title: Israeli strike in Gaza kills three journalists, first responders say
item.description: Another eight Palestinians were killed by Israeli artillery and gunfire across Gaza on Wednesday, according to medics.
